thread.title_full: Kerala: Severe Weather Warning: Orange Alert for Rainfall in Kerala's Pathanamthitta and Palakkad | Kochi News - Times of India

author: Times Of India
title: Kerala: Severe Weather Warning: Orange Alert for Rainfall in Kerala's Pathanamthitta and Palakkad | Kochi News - Times of India
text: Kochi: IMD has issued a heavy rainfall alert for Kerala until Sunday. An orange alert has been issued for Pathanamthitta and Palakkad on Friday. Thunderstorms with lightning are very likely to occur at one or two places in Kerala on Sunday and Monday.Rainfall is influenced by an upper air cyclonic circulation over the Southwest Arabian Sea, extending up to 1.5km above mean sea level. The cyclonic circulation over the Gulf of Mannar and its neighbourhood persists and is observed at 0.9km above mean sea level.A yellow alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Kottayam, Idukki, and Malappuram on Friday, while Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Idukki, and Palakkad are on alert on Saturday. An isolated heavy rainfall warning for 7-11cm has been issued for Thrissur, Palakkad, Kozhikode, and Wayanad on Sunday.The maximum temperature was appreciably above normal in Kozhikode district and above normal in Kottayam, Palakkad, Kollam, Thiruvananthapuram, and Thrissur districts. Minimum temperatures were above normal in Malappuram, Ernakulam, Kottayam, Kozhikode, Kollam, and Thiruvananthapuram districts. Kozhikode recorded the highest maximum temperature of 36°C, and Kannur airport recorded the lowest minimum temperature of 23.7°C. As the first month of the Northeast monsoon came to a close, the state experienced a 22% deficiency, with Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Kasaragod, Kollam, Kottayam, Malappuram, Pathanamthitta, and Thrissur districts being rain deficient.
